author: NASS
description:
I colorized, fully restored, and crafted the sound design for this rare archival footage of Belgrade in 1945, capturing views across the Sava River toward Zemun and the Zemun Bridge, placards displayed throughout the city, the steeple of the Serbian Orthodox Cathedral (Saborna Crkva), and scenes of everyday urban life with people entering and leaving, vehicles, horse-drawn carts, trolley cars, and pedestrians crossing the bridge, as well as Belgrade’s main streets and Terazije Square featuring the Albanija Building and the Balkan Hotel, alongside images of the Russian grave at Knežev Spomenik Square, the National Opera Theatre in Belgrade, and close details such as inscriptions on gravestones and the red star crowning the monument.

Video Restoration Process:
✔ FPS boosted to 60 frames per second 
✔ Image resolution boosted up to HD 
✔ Improved video sharpness and brightness 
✔ Colorized only for the ambiance (not historically accurate)
✔added sound only for the ambiance
✔restoration:
title: Belgrade 1945 in Color, After World War II [60fps, Remastered] Sound Design
